questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the `useMemo` hook in React?
options: A. To handle side effects in functional components
B. To memoize expensive calculations so they aren't re-run on every render
C. To manage state in a functional component
D. To pass data down the component tree without prop drilling

questions.question: What problem does the Context API solve?
options: C. The need to pass props through many intermediate components (prop drilling)

questions.question: A Higher-Order Component (HOC) in React is a...?
options: A. Component that is rendered above all others
B. Function that takes a component and returns a new component with extra props or logic
C. Special type of class component

questions.question: What is code-splitting in React?
options: A. Splitting your code into multiple files
B. A pattern for creating smaller bundles that can be loaded on demand
C. A way to split a component into smaller components

questions.question: What is the key difference between `useEffect` and `useLayoutEffect`?
options: A. `useEffect` runs after the component renders, but before the browser paints
B. `useLayoutEffect` runs synchronously after all DOM mutations, but before the browser paints
D. `useLayoutEffect` is for class components only
